data.question: What is the formula of the metal-organic nanosphere synthesized from H3L and Cd(NO3)2·4H2O in DMF at 150 °C?
What is the Euler characteristic (χ) of the Cd66 cluster?
What happens when H3L reacts with Cd(NO3)2·4H2O at lower temperatures?
data.answer: It affords coordination polymer frameworks instead of nanospheres.

data.question: True or False: The Cd66 cluster has a dual-shell structure.
What is the external diameter of the Cd66 cluster?
What is the role of NO3- anions in the structure of the Cd66 cluster?
True or False: The synthesis of the Cd66 nanosphere is not reproducible.
What is the internal diameter of the Cd66 cluster?
True or False: The Cd66 cluster can be considered a metal-organic nanosphere.
What happens when H3L reacts with CdCl2 instead of Cd(NO3)2·4H2O?
data.answer: It also affords coordination polymer frameworks.

data.question: True or False: The Cd66 cluster is soluble in CHCl3, C6H5Me, and C6H6.
What is the molecular weight of the Cd66 cluster?
True or False: The Cd66 cluster has a polydeltahedron shape.
What is the role of DMF in the synthesis of the Cd66 cluster?
data.answer: It acts as a solvent and ligand.

data.question: True or False: The Cd66 cluster has C3 crystallographic symmetry.
What is the space group of the Cd66 cluster?
True or False: The Cd66 cluster contains 1238 non-hydrogen atoms.
What is the symmetry of the Cd66 cluster?
True or False: The Cd66 cluster is composed of a spherical shell of 66 Cd(II) cations.
What is the role of the tripodal capping ligands in the Cd66 cluster?
data.answer: They surround the spherical shell of Cd(II) cations.
